description.narrative: The project #Promoting sustainable and responsible production of rattan/bamboo through business development support# is a one-year project which is to be implemented from June 2015 to December 2015 in two provinces: Thanh Hoa and Nghe An, under the financial support of # 55,000 from Oxfam. With a view to promoting the sustainable and responsible production of rattan/bamboo products in Vietnam, the project aims to develop a pilot model in which SMEs in rattan and bamboo sectors are supported to apply effectively global quality standards as well as other market development initiatives, together with supportive policies and regulations. It will be carried out in coordination with Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI), Research Institute for Sustainable Forest Management andForest Certification (SFMI), Academy of Forest Sciences (FAFS) and a number of enterprises operating in rattan/bamboo sectors in Nghe An and Thanh Hoa provinces. To achieve its objective, the project#s main interventions include: Research and policy advocacy, Partnership, coalition establishment and capacity building and Strong engagement of private sector. More specifically, it will start with a study and assessment of rattan/bamboo value chain in Vietnam and possibly neighboring countries, focusing on current status of global certificates or quality standards by SMEs, natural resource management, market and labor issues, gender and women#s empowerment in the value chain. Based on the research results, more business development support activities will be provided by different stakeholders and partners, particularly Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI). Capacity building activities for farmers and small scale producers as well as the involvement and commitment of SMEs in the this field is expected to make contribution to more sustainable and responsible consumption and production of rattan/bamboo products in Vietnam.

participating-org.narrative: The Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry
